Posts.Content: Hi Nutmeg Can I just throw in a thought...perhaps it is only when we 'stop' that the dark thoughts, feelings and moods get a chance to swirl to the surface. Maybe we need to find a slot during the day...a small, safe, bit of time and place to let go.  Easier said than done I know. I never did do much sleep, never in bed before midnight and then probably working or at least reading there. I had high standards and was always full on in work, study etc etc and then I became unwell and had to take time off work...which I never did. My body scrolled through all kinds of symptoms starting with a nasty skin infection, turbo flu type stuff etc. Eventually I was diagnosed with Chronic Fatigue and Fibromyalgia. I attempted to get back to work and the old me...took a while to accept I had to be new me.  Just to add fun to the mix, Fibro means unrefreshing sleep and often vivid dreams. Hmmmm I have always had dreams that are like Hollywood movies in that they are never wispy fragments and vague images,.... they are fully detailed Technicolor experiences. Eventually I accepted I needed help with night time pain if I was to get what ever sleep was available. So I take amitriptyline...or I should. I found that I have to take them at least as early as 6pm if I am not to be wiped out and woolly headed the next day. I have those attributes from CF and Fibro already, thanks. I had my gastrectomy surgery December last year and didn't take them afterwards because as soon as I reclined in bed never mind laid flat....my lungs filled with fluid and I had to cough robustly to clear it. I am now trying to get back into routine of taking them but sometimes the the effects next day make it extra hard to get stuff done and sleep is still bity. Ooh this was going to be a quick post. Failed. Take care and good luck with finding solutions
Posts.Title: Not Sleeping

Posts.Content: Hi and welcome Just adding another invite to the awake thread. Full of nutters if a bit of distraction and silliness is what you are after, but the same people have a wealth of experience of the full gamut of issues that cancer brings...so if its a hug, advice, a shoulder, a pillow to punch...whatever you need when you should be asleep, come say hi. By the way...tell us about your new couch... jealous already : ) Take care

Posts.Title: Not Sleeping

Posts.Content: Hi I am so glad that things are looking brighter today. By choice I didn't tell my family that I was going into hospital for surgery, my partner was away and one friend had to move into my home to look after my dog and parrot.  Hospital was in the next city so I only had one visit from a pal.  All my choice and unlike yourself, although I had my own room, day after surgery I had to be up and walking. The hospital is huge so I walked a lot. Even through the night as I couldn't lie down as fluid collected in my chest and walking took the slightest edge off my digestive acid  volcano pain...I had a gastrectomy. So yes, nights can seem very long. Fast forward to my pet sitter in hospital...minutes from my house, eventually diagnosed with TB and so in isolation. I had constant phonecalls with issues I 'had' to go and sort out...like he desperately needed tissues... no one had sorted his TV for hours.. he hadn't been given a meal as there was none left etc etc....all not really true ...he was just bored.  He had me go shopping  for so many food items n treats n stuff, drip by drip, but so often he could have opened his own shop : ) He isn't really social so there was no one else to go visit but ..really??? So you see.. you are doing really well and I do hope you make it to your son's carol service...fab for both of you. PS...stop feeling guilty...you need to be well for him and this time of year he is probably having a whale of a time and being spoiled. Good luck and take care
Posts.Title: Feeling lonely in hospital

Posts.Content: Hi V Awwe you are making me all warm n fuzzy : ) The nature of this site means that often the most urgent posts are seeking help and coming to terms with shock or bad news... so its lovely to see so many positive stories coming through 'up front' as it were, in the last few days. I love your attitude... sometimes its easy to fall into the mindset of appearing strong for others... but this can often mean lots of emotions don't have an outlet and can't be worked through... whereas your post literally sounds like a big breath of fresh air...letting it all out so that you can draw in all the goodness. May your good luck continue, take care
Posts.Title: Today’s Results from my lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Hi DL Great news! Koo! All these resolutions and its not even New Year yet!  I saw myself sans most clothes in a changing room mirror yesterday....sheeeeeesh! Not good!  When did I acquire this old lady bumpy skin n flubber???? Need intensive....something! Just tried taking dog out for a bracing walk in our maximum 2 degrees fresh air...once out, he very quickly decided the sofa was winning the bet : ) Good luck and take care
Posts.Title: Today’s Results from my lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Eeeeeeek! I am new to this so didn't know shingles was a thing! Had shingles when I was 6 and they were UNBELIEVABLY painful. I couldn't have clothing on my waist but even if someone else in the room moved...the air movement the shingled bit sensed was nasty. Much sympathy for anyone having to cope with this on top of other stuff. Non touchy hugs : )
Posts.Title: Shingles?

Posts.Content: FANTASTIC! Thank you so much for posting.... says far more than 'please don't worry' ever can. Cheers
Posts.Title: Got biopsy result back

Posts.Content: Hi just popping by to give you a quick hug. I understand that your confused and emotional....you had steeled yourself to hear one thing and heard something else....with no clear direction yet. Don't be hard on yourself, its a lot to get your head around and hopefully someone with a similar experience will be along soon. Good luck and take care
Posts.Title: Genetics results - No mutation found

Posts.Content: Hi Scarlett, Can I just butt in and ask about the nature of the work that you do?  I am just wondering about making the most of any workplace resources, policy and provisions. For years I worked as what was laughably called a casual employee...the whole team were 'casual' and worked fulltime for years. It meant however, that we only got paid for the hours worked, so no holiday pay or sick pay. Eventually campaigning efforts paid off and our contracts were converted to ...Zero Hours ...this meant we didn't have to be offered any hours of work but were expected to accept all that we were offered....and this was an improvement : ) At least it meant we got the going rate per hour and average hours worked could be used to calculate entitlements. Is your workplace aware of your health situation? Are they supportive? Are they a large employer so they have room to maneuver or is it a small business? Sorry if this seams nosey...it just appears that you on your own are running very fast to just stand still...not even good for someone in robust health. It does look like you have explored this with your bank...did you do this in person, face to face or online...if they couldn't help did they have any suggestions? I better stop as this sounds like an interrogation. Hope you find a less stressful way through the coming weeks, good luck, take care
Posts.Title: Genetics results - No mutation found

Posts.Content: Hi to Scarlett first of all....brilliant that at least one huge weight has been lifted and you can now work, get some pennies in the pot, and enjoy Christmas with your partner and little one...especially as last year didn't quite go to plan.  Also it will help to get a few more weeks in, showing your newish employer that you are worth hanging on to and accommodating : ) Really hope you and your littlie, and partner of course, have a lovely relaxed Christmas  and you are fighting fit for the next bit of your treatment. Good luck and take care. Hi to Kirsti... sheesh..your nerve is being tested..although absence due to sickness can't really be avoided, knowing that,  doesn't make the extra wait any less frustrating and worrisome. It does sound like you might have to 'argue' for your preferred option. I am sure you have thought very carefully about your decision but it might help to show that you are making an informed choice rather than wanting drastic action due to worry. So for example, you could ask your "expert' to reiterate the evidence for, and benefits of, their proposal....meanwhile I would have done a quick bit of research so I knew what was going to be said and could then calmly explain that yes, I gave that a lot of thought but in MY situation, I feel that.,..bla blaa...whether it is reduced chance of further problems...or fewer possible surgeries or greater peace of mind...or whatever.  I always think it helps to show that you have given the same amount of time and thought weighing up benefits and consequences of all options rather than championing one. Years of Trade Union negotiations : ) so I hope I don't sound patronising and school teacherish ...and I know that once we are in our appointments...we are not always as 'together' as we would hope. Hope you actually make your appointment, on time and not too stressed....and hope your 'bad week' doesn't sabotage it. Good luck and take care.
Posts.Title: Genetics results - No mutation found

Posts.Content: Hi to everyone, Its lovely to hear people are doing well or even better than expected... or at least treatment plans ate not hijacking g the rest of life. Good luck and take care
Posts.Title: Genetics results - No mutation found

Posts.Content: Hi and yes thanks I am doing OK. Yes, I too worked in catering and hospitality for years (among or as well as other things).  Along with all the pitfalls of the inconsistency of work hours as the business fluctuates and the unsociable hours, in a probably low paid job,  I suppose some of the benefits are the possible savings on childcare (as shifts can be outside of partners day work) and the option to pick up extra shifts at busy times....but of course the run up to Christmas is usually boom time. I used to depend on working silly amounts of hours working days and evenings to afford Christmas : ) but you get to know all the words to all the Christmas songs that there have EVER been when you do 20+ works Christmas parties : ) Good luck with your next appointment where hopefully you get will get some idea of the sorts of things that HAVE to happen at the proposed times and where there might be a little wiggle room. Sorry you are having to wrestle finance along with your health. Take care
Posts.Title: Genetics results - No mutation found

Posts.Content: YAY...the furry ones are getting the benefit too : ) Ooh will you walk with an accent in France? Wishing you many Zippy gallops ....love that name. Haven't slept at all and got a huge to do list do we will just see how the day pans out.  Oh forgot to count the couple of times overnight and this morning that I had dog out!! So half a tick. Well done everyone
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi...posted this yesterday on the Extreme Fatigue thread but wanted it here too. Ooh looks like I managed to copy and paste... Wahoo! Well...inspired, I stopped dithering about re ordering my to do list and took the dog out. He was rescued as a tiny puppy from a horrendous life and now is mostly fab...except fireworks. Add in his intelligence and memory and dusk is associated with fireworks etc. Plus, around here, firework season is most of year.  Anyway his 'safe place' is the bingo...no he doesn't have his own dabber, their car park is mostly empty and surrounded by grass n trees n a big fence...he couldn't wait to get there... ...but nearby construction noise included pop pop popping so he bolted... I did get him to come back HURRAY but one very stressed doggy till home. I am annoyed kuz this is his refuge and the last time we were there, just days ago, some eejits set off two horrendously loud bangers....barely dusk and not associated with any cultural event!!! so he bolted then too and he is as fast as a whippet... which I think is in his genes : ) Anyway I feel rubbish n nose running like tap and can I request that as for weeks over Christmas etc I already did the returning lurgy, so please can I be excused another doze? Can I claim my outing as two sprints? Cheers
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi Well folks again no proper walk...had dog out briefly a couple times and did my usual hobby of going to buy electric!. Then went to hospital minutes away to make use of their heat and light in the restaurant while I sat and studied possible routes for Friday.  I definitely want a certificate in logistics although train prices are not even distant relatives of logic. Looks like as usual, its a crack of dawn coach then train then bus then taxi then turn around and same home. Getting on for a 19 hour round trip! So after a brief walk of dog again, I walked to dog sitters to give him the 'good' news about the times. He is a sweetie as although he is in his 70s and has chronic back pain, he says he will have my furry one the night before and keep him till the morning after I get back. This is as well as having his partner come stay...she has no hearing, or speech, uses sign language , has very limited vision, is diabetic and recently was in a coma from several strokes. So she needs physical assistance, cruelly one arm is affected and of course she uses hands to communicate, and although a marvel considering what she has been through, can be very demanding and insistent... in other words hard work. Her son moved himself, wife and young children in to her small house to look after her. He and his wife work opposite shifts at the same place so they are always 'on duty' and they and my dog sitter try and do as much as they can before waving the flag and saying 'can you take over again'. Well as you can see my late night kitchen wrangling has ground to halt with a cupper break  : ) Well done for everyone who got over the doorstep and those who thought they might...its a start. Oh yes, this being secret is fine but EVERYBODY should have someone with whom they don't have to be strong and can let it all out...outside of the family maybe....but we have to let the bleeeurgh out so that the YAY can get in! Take care
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: I agree with LeoLady....Toxo that sounds VERY energetic...n puppies are  an important vehicle in client service interface. Take care
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: @Pennylane It takes dedication and a feather to develop the full syndrome so short term exposure and avoiding avian plucky groomers should see you alright. Ah...the swish of the waterproof trouser... takes you right back to shell suits.  For those under 50 consult grandma or Google. Other search engines are available. Cheers
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Leolady56 I am frequently on the edge... though of what not always sure and often not too convinced I should step off : ) Actually ...when my B12 is due 'on the edge' kinda sums me up. Hmmm must explore that some more. One of these posts will be about walking... honest : ) Take care and well done to everyone who had been out or who is promising themselves they will. Had lots of snow here but the layer didn't last too long once stopped. Though it was definitely cold enough even though the wind wasn't as biting. Cheers
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Leolady56umm...do you know something I don't? Don't leave you? Err...don't think I am leaving the site : ) Friday I am traveling but it is a round trip so be back at midnight. Dog sitter keeping my dog overnight Thursday as I leave at crack of dawn and because he be in bed before midnight he keeping him Friday night too....it is all wrong when I come in and he is not here...but he loves the sitter.. he is his best friend kuz he gets spoiled..cooked breakfasts etc!!!! Finally got my B12 this morn so hopefully start to feel better. Busy busy time and loads to do at weekend...house stuff etc ain't life exciting ooh yeah tomorrow is ...glass fusion n stuff. If running to GP and scuttling  round town for cleaning and dog supplies counts then I walked today.  It was freezing at 3am when I had dog out! Black ice...still freezing at breakfast when at GP, freezing in town and still freezing now!!! Err I think you get that it is cold : ) Take care
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Fuuuuu! Me and my man took dog to the beech...that is after I returned from bus stop kuz didn't have travel pass and then couldn't reopen front door with the key I had cut for him and then of course the bus whizzed passed. Lots of other dogs there but we timed tide so there was lots of beech and there was lots of fresh air too! OK we have popped down to see our pal the dog sitter so now I have had a cupper I am going to leave them having a catch up and go home to enjoy the solitude...and after all that fresh air maybe a nap. Ha, I have needed a lie down since hearing the price of chips I bought us : ) Take care

Posts.Content: Violetsniff|  yeah but this will be the last time I have to do this trip WAHOO! Hope everyone manages 5 mins peace and quiet...or a rant n shout...whatever you need Take care

Posts.Content: Walking today was...mostly about my man...accompanying him to appointments and then this evening attempting to escort him home from pals. He is still there : ) On the plus side my lovely doggy is moving much better so hopefully tomorrow we will get a proper walk in. Ha, after my man has been back up to GP at crack of dawn  for blood tests...I going to love his thick head in morning : ) mrsox..hope your little fur ball had perked up. Those doing mega steps...I am in awe!! Take care
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: More BG.  Was saying on awake thread..  Outrageously sore throat n general fluey ugh but need go get my dog v soon. Paracetmol, tea n yoghurt.... Fuuuuuu temp is through roof... Could have done with that yesterday when I was freezing  walking to nearest village with bus!! Take care
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Violetsniff|  100 miles!??? That a typo? Or you training  for Himalayan trek? Take care
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Thankyou all for my birthday wishes....a group of unicorns is a 'blessing' so I am well and truly blessed : ) Went to glass fusion and jewellery making session and discovered kilns are like washing machines and socks...lots of my bits that went in there didn't come out! Ooh but two pendant pieces are good... will do photo later. Afternoon me and pal went looking at houses as hers has to be sold due to hubby leaving. It has taken her a long time to be able to face this so hurray!. The first was too small...she has a fab bull midriff who has a suitably large cage which is his own space to sleep etc and there was absolutely no where this could be placed.. Second one was better in terms of room proportions, a spot for crate, a tiny garden  but there has obviously been a problem with water egress either from the roof or water tank above bedroom and landing.  The woman from estate agent showing us around claimed not to have noticed!. Odd woman...I expected someone in office clobber representing the estate agent but... and I am usually all for individualism... she was an old dear who had a strange woolly hat, bingo boots, two smears of 70s blue eye-shadow vaguely under her eyes etc. Pal also had a viewing of her place before we walked her mastiff. I had no coat and it was freezing but I went!. (Polished halo). Hopefully dogs limp clears up as he off to Crufts in the veterans class! Then visited my dog sitter pal where my man and minger pal were celebrating my birthday with bacon sandwiches. Excellent for a vegetarian! Did get some bio oil as gift...works on my gasectomy scar. Walked home, homemade soup and was falling asleep so went bed...and slept YAY! Well done to everyone who did and tomorrow's another day for those who didn't and very interesting re Jewellery quarter . Cheers
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Ha! Can't wait to tell pal that I mentioned her bull midriff and that it has it has a suitably huge crate : ) Got love predictively text!. We'll... again no official walk apart from nipping my dog out several times. Me and my man went to Chinese buffet.. lovely but of course my innards protested muchly for hours afterwards. OK my man going to view cottage to rent in morn so really need try the sleep thing Well done for all good efforts and good intentions Nyt
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Yes the beech was beautiful... thanks to the remaining dregs of lurgy I still couldn't smell the sea air but it was certainly doing its thing. The man wants to go again in the morning but as he is snoring on sofa after....doh just substitute winj winj winj or see the awake thread, I am not sure how early he will be up and out to accommodate the tide.  : ) Well done to everyone who got out, with or without a buttie incentive, and to everyone who really might definitely do it next time. Take care
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: seaspirit44 Your alarm reminded me that all the females were given one when I was at university. It was a small handheld thing with a looped cord handle that you pulled to activate the earsplitting scream. Well my pal  Murial left hers on the sofa while she was out at college which was really going to help!! Anyway her husband and son were home and noticed an odd loop protruding from the sofa, like it had eaten an umbrella and so....yep...they pulled it...and of course it came out...minus the alarm...which had activated...once over the shock they spent a considerable amount of time trying to get the unrelenting  screecher out of the sofa : ) Not been out for a walk in its own right since beach but did somehow buy boots on an unexpected shopping trip with pal. I'd like to say they are sturdy all weather walkers but umm they are these Oops! To everyone getting out or very nearly, almost getting out, well done. Take care
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Awwe thanks WhatHappened. Ooh yes get potting! Having said that...I have some expensive kit that I have not had out of box as I want to get everything tidy and sorted first...ahem! Ooh what sort jewelry did dad do? Doggy was 'lame' after lots of running for ball at beech but us bright eyed and bushy tailed again. Yes...nasties on pavement ate gastronomic treasures but he dies decline several types of dig treats.  : ) Take care
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Trying yo catch up on millions of posts. Flipping fffffreeezin here with snow and ice , horizontal snow, hail, wind. Snow varies ankle to knee deep! Been out with dog and to mans new place which is less than 5 mins walk away. Taps...very suprised cobbler didn't have any...any cobbler near a dance school will. When you buy tap shoes they tend to come with toe taps ...but they are poor and so everyone has them replaced and adds heel taps too. Bonus is if you have a little sibling their grown out of toe taps can become your heel taps  : ) Brands are  AJK or Teletone etc. Well done to everyone getting out...photos are fan. For those not into extreme sports and who can't get the door open or whose two dressing gowns have become welded to their onesie ... count the trips to the kettle and treat tub : )  Take care You can also try the mega low tech option of gluing lots of 2p coins to gym shoes/plimsolls. Never tried this but apparently kids do it for community performances etc.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: My phone has big problems and isn't even lighting up properly. The Gill is an area of grass and trees that leads to the riverside. Dog loved it. My icicles over window doubled in size yesterday They are over four feet...hope there is no one under them when they finally go...remember I am one floor up!. Well done if you got out...I better post this while can, take care
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Oih well done!! Decision as to what to do was taken out officially my hands as I lay on sofa and .... Zzzzzzx till now. Ssshhhh I feel little better though nose still like tap and thought would turn self inside out earlier with a 'cough'...must be rubbish going down back of throat so proposed self up to snooze. Take care
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Happybird|umm washing the curtains is fairly easy once hey down... its alktbe clutter and cleaning that is hard work. Anyway it seems a cupoer and having to catch shop before shut means they still up there : ) Ooh....me and my parrot love the anthems and give it some wellie...and then judge which team won the singing : )  I believe any player who hasn't mastered their anthem words should forfeit their team place...unless they were unexpectedly snapped up the day before of course. Well really have to move Take care
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Koo U am very impressed withhowbusy you lit have been...and sporting the chi chi Sox n boots!! Well umm err I have ...not exactly walked. Not much sleep..and for once not because I couldn't...I went to bed at 5pm teatime...couple hours sleep as felt rough...very rare for me to listen to body and actually ho to bed rather than recline on sofa. Anyway most know the saga if my man and why more sleep didn't feature much! Did walk to get stuff done locally and later bus to town to get sack of dog food. Good news is my doggie had really oerjed up and is in play mode again...though I busy tomorrow...arty in morn fusing glass and making g jewelkry and then the afternoon viewing houses with pal. Oh yeah its my birthday! Take care and perhaps some of us can benefit osmotically from those who have been super energetically : )
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi all just a very quick note to say walking was around town to mans appointment and then meet his 'brother' in pub for catch up. The notable thing was ...I wore shoes... you know, not boot or trainers but actual shoes with a little heel that clipped when I walked!!! Exception though and normal service had been resumed. Trainers to take dog out. Well done to everyone emerging from the snow drifts and oh yeah my icicles part dripped away and part dropped away without spearing anything alive. Take care
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Helloooo to everyone I only seem to get to post in snatches these days but I do read everything. Sympathy to all suffering, waiting, recovering or putting up with additional rubbish be that folk, events or health. Well the good news is that my man got confirmation today that his accommodation can go ahead HURRAY! So walking today (and previous days with crossed fingers as he had the keys) was back and forth to his cottage and mine transporting stuff. As there are lots of stairs at mine (the reason its unsuitable for him) even my aches have aches and I am posting from the bath... Gingerbread candled and bubbles.... Ooh fatigue...and hives....sheesh, I have Fibromyalgia which basically means you ate wrecked, major symptoms fatigue and pain, but....often it is a hive like sensation, electric ants in your skin that WON'T stop. Believe me I have tried everything and if calling the fire brigade or the FBI would have helped they would be on speed dial. I took to reading in the bath for hours simply because my hands couldn't leave the book to scratch...which didn't relieve anyway. But....the strangest thing worked like magic.. You can get a huge tub in 'cheap ' shops under names like Freeze, Ice etc...it is blue menthol gel...sounds quite contraindicative but the relief is sooooo good and as it's so cheap you can slap loads on. Just realised I should have tried to tag this but hope it helps. Well done to those getting out or thinking about it especially fabulous aunties.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi finally caught up with posts and well done to those getting out regularly. Mostly my walking is still between this place and my mans new place..but can I have extra points as its to drag lots of heavy awkward stuff there by hand?. Often I am walking backwards pulling a laden shopping bag trolley. Yes I do know this is a ridiculous way to move house. Unsurprisingly, my Fibromyalgia is flaring so am pleased to be upright and anything else is a bonus : ) Oh yeah took dog to beach, man lost ball in deep pool in first two minutes so was socks n shoes off, trousers rolled up above knees, definitely not beach ready and water was bone numbingly cold!!!! Didn't even find ball!! This shows how unbothered the dog was re loss of ball as he had found a prize rock. Not appreciating our efforts over knee deep in a huge pool!! Take care
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Fuuu! Am keeping up with posts... Just! Very busy...yes still getting my mans stuff to his place and trying to put this place back together. The lucky boy has been given two lively brown leather sofas by his landlord and so with my bed (my place already has one) the new place is getting there  Though mostly he has taken art stuff and plant bits as the thing he likes about the new place is the yard. There is absolutely no outdoor space here...not even a window box or doorstep. Sooo today we went off to a garden store...lovely walk around in sun and got some reduced little plants,  but no one offered him a seat on bus back so he was in agony and then I had to get off bus as felt nauseous ..what a pair : ) Well done to all getting out, taking pics, posing puzzles... and to those just thinking about it.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Oh dear....frowning upon galloping...you should have earnestly explained it's your life saving physio!! Hmmmm not really news that getting your heart rate up is good.... I suppose the 10 thousand steps really just helps you think about how much you move in your day...people putting them on their dog while they themselves watch TV obviously know that's doing them no good whatsoever. I remember years ago, some bloke declaring that housework used up next to no calories at all and me indignantly shouting that  flicking a duster along a mantel shelf ...probably not... lugging a cylinder hoover up the stairs as you went...definitely yes.... rinsing the soap dish in the bathroom ...no...brooming dog hair off your carpet...definitely yes! Umm this has been revised in later years... the broom replaced by trainer type soles and each foot scraping backwards on the carpet (me not the dog....but that's an idea!)...making big furballs and REALLY working your thighs and abdomen and definitely getting your heart rate up : ) Cheers
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Umm ironically I have been too busy scurrying about to post!! After lunch took dog out very briefly, bus to town.. walk walk couldn't get what needed, bus over river walk walk, laden down with bags, walk to bus stop. Two buses home. Walk dog briefly, realise need to buy electric, took dog on hike to late shop...doh should have taken pic if drama...parked car on fire, fire brigade called.... late shop shut!!! Hike back, brigade rolling up hoses...hike to petrol station, also shut! Give up . No sleep deliberately do don't sleep in as need to be in two places at once at 9 am. Between now and then need to make two cards and wrap three gifts etc but I am in bath : ) Hopefully will soon get some pics of pleasant walks but traveling to see my man tomorrow or is it today? We'll Friday! Well done everyone, take care

Drag heavy bag back home.... Nuff winjing..I back in bath, yes again so no pictures again...though I do seem to do a lot more in bath than others do...so scribbling next time might happen. Posts.Content: Umm BG? I see it in my post but I may not have put it...possibly bugs? Anyway watching rugby counts as exercise depending on how excitable n involved you get : ) Doh I have retreated to bath...forced myself to go get dog n improved slightly, only to to get home and TMI warning ....major poo incident !!! Least I was home. Ooh I lucky kuz I live next door to fab independent pharmacy. When I collapsed etc I crawled down strairs and got a passerby to go summon the staff from there for help. My parcels go there too kuz postie never waits till I get downstairs.  I am prevaricating ...do I risk go town ( can I even remember what for) or do a bit of house that really needs done. Ha! all I am doing plenty of is prevaricating ! Take care
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Gee thanks to everyone concerned about my germ filled state. Sssshhhh but my throat pain is now bearable but yesterday I did resort to huge tissue plugs up each nostril....yes there are probably lots of Health n Safety reasons why this is a bad idea but it literally was like two taps and sandpapering off the skin. Marginally better right now. Thanks for suggesting cleaning help but I would have needed to organise that before now. Those following the drama know I had to make an unplanned trip on Friday. Such adventures eat into my energy given Fibromyalgia but realistically the state of my house results from a culmination of factors. Unexpectedly, my man had to go south, so I moved into his place to look after the pets. You can imagine an unplanned move...and a move into a place that hadn't had the existing stuff moved out of it. Anyway health took an unexpected turn when I discovered I needed surgery for a tumour and subsequent recovery. Still doesn't really justify the state of place but hey ...good news my man is coming back up here... hurray... Hang on...at last minute the accommodation he though was sorted isn't happening. Unfortunately he couldn't simply move back into his old place with me as his health has deteriorated and his back means he can't really manage stairs. This place has a big step through front door, then lots of stairs as its first floor flat, and stairs between living room, kitchen, bathroom etc.  Initially he will have to come here whilst looking for somewhere more appropriate...and he will be here tomorrow.... aaaargh!  Need to get my act together. However...whatever gets done, gets done. Could have done without this lurgy though : ) Take care

Tomorrow or technically today I am supposed to be out at my craft activities session... but I don't think I can handle him 'organising' more of my stuff in my absence!!! Well done to everyone who got out and to those who very nearly definitely almost got out. Take care.

Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Wow! Get you lot! Well impressed. Well I had an unscheduled walk on thurs night...went shopping to large Tesco where there is also a little £shop n BnM etc. Surprisingly my man said he was coming. Siiiiigh! He is a physical wreck... he used to work in Outdoor Ed so mountaineering, canoeing etc etc and along with the wear and tear that gives bodies, he also fell off a mountain...roped up, so suffered big scale whiplash type injury which wrecked his back. He had an operation on his shoulder a year ago...apparently there was nothing holding it together and a loose piece of chipped bone in there. Anyway his back is giving him a lot of pain now and effects his mobility and balance...which messes with his alpha male thing and he was out of painkillers. Shopping??? Off we  set, two buses to get there and as we arrived I noticed that the lane of traffic that services the bus stops for return journey was CLOSED! He hobbled around shops and had, had enough before I even got to checkout. Then a lonnnnnng walk back into town to get final bus back...me pulling trolley full of grub. Gluttons for punishment, painkillers then took dog to beach today.  Looks empty but actually there were a lot of other dogs and their people out...the sun was even out and the early morning frost and chill breeze warmed up a few degrees. Once home I immediately went back to town to get all the stuff missed in the shop last night because...ahem let's just say usual routine interrupted : ) Did arrive back to my tea cooked and ready to serve. After which dog and man and eventually me lay about in stiff, broken heaps! Take care and to all not quite getting out, hope everyone's pics giving a little lift.

Harrumph! Do take care

Posts.Content: Happybird You can buy the plastic to do proper shrinking...not just crisp packets : ) Of course they want to sell you stuff...the packets are the stylish, free carry case that comes with your tasty pomme de terre morsels. Ooh you reminded me, however, of sporting a new outfit of skinnyrib red jumper and navy trousers and standing in front of the gas fire. On walking away, the extremely hot trousers slapped the back of my legs so I pinched them and held them away from my skin for a moment...only to discover they had 'set' in a peak on each leg. Obviously not all natural material! Afterwards I had to wear them back to front so my knees were in the peaks! Luckily as a child there wasn't much shape to make a difference to the pull on style : ) I know ...what a sartorial picture I am creating : ) Take care Cheers
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi as ronstar says you need to look at your area. Some schemes have been in place for years as GP exercise referral programs but may have snazzy titles like Move to Improve. Some have specific conditions for referral, some more general including stress and anxiety. Facilities vary depending on the participating venues and not all services may be accessible via the scheme but can include pools.  The schemes usually run for a number of weeks with hope that you will be motivated to continue afterwards. It may well be worth looking at gym or 'wellness centre' ordinary membership in your area....yes the Local Authority or ex LA centres as concessionary membership may open up a whole host of opportunities like dance, bowls etc  All this from me, laid on the sofa exhausted from sleeping all day! Take care

Posts.Title: Day 4 post surgery

Posts.Content: Winky49 ... I don't have my specs with me so this could get interesting! Accommodating someone's needs is sadly open to interpretation as are phrases like 'reasonable adjustments'.... but the spirit of legislation and statutory regulations would imply that the accommodation dies not make the process of carrying out your duties more difficult (really??) or your working environment  to have inferior facilities to those generally on offer to other emoloyees.  As it is not uncommon for an office worker to work in a single employee room, that in itself would be difficult to challenge as unreasonable.  However, you did not request these changes to your working situation...nor I  am assuming agreed to them. Therefore they are changed imposed due to your health and which you as detrimental to the ease with which you can carry out your duties. Go you in making it as inconvenient for them as possible in having everyone and and everything come to you. I don't say this for devilment...it evidences how much more be f an effort is in involved in you being able to do your job...in other words  , how many times you would have go go retrieve info, contact folk, duplicate paperwork, etc. There are hard and soft issues here. By this I mean that some aspects are clearly covered within the parameters of regulations and some are not so easily defined but definitely need addressing. Can I also point out that temperature, air con etc cause ongoing problems in many places as its often difficult to get a situation acceptable to all in a room... personal preference, who HAS to sit near/under the unit. There are many things which make a workplace function that aren't identified ...sometimes they only become apparent when something  is changed, discontinued or banned. One example of this is the stream of 'chattet' in the workplace... yes this is the social glue that holds groups together (or not) but often is also the way everyone knows what's happening... it mesns there are no formal checks that everyone who needs to know something does know, no official means through which those affected by something that no one thought they needed to know can become aware of it, who is meeting whom and why and what happened, names and faces and how each role fits in to the wider organisation, whose workload is building up and who can help, who has knowledge and skills outside of their role and fills gaps and smooths bumps...and the famous 'knows where the bodies are buried' Part-time employees come up against this all the time as they start their shift with 'nothings happened'... even things that make it onto notice/message boards get wiped before everyone has seen them. You don't say what sort or size employer you have...they will have workplace policies...(not necessarily good ones) probably on line. Is there a Trade Union presence? Their policies are onion and do contact them...if you are not a member..for a small fee and short run in time ( can't get services instantly to deter folk simply joining when want help and their strength is in numbers and employees who give their time to advocate, campaign and represent etc)...mine of info and support and will have disability/welfare officer. If not...try local disability rights groups etc in your area...you have enough to do in managing your health so get help in challenging your employer. I suspect they have taken what they think is the easiest option in moving you rather than deal with the rest of the room. Don't make it easy. Cab I also say...forewarned is forearmed... this can get messy and they may wish to question your 'capability'...,sooo right now, compile lits of evidence that you are on it and they have recognised that... so any performance reviews etc, training plans or request or completed. . other meetings not about you or your work but where it has been relied on or would have shown if it not up to scratch, deadlines met or beaten. OK I will stop...hope there are some actual words as I cannot see : ) Good luck...take care

Posts.Title: Recall after mammogram

Posts.Content: Hi folks... as we have managed to compartmentalise most of life and medicalise stuff which just used to be life...a lot of 'chat' and social interaction  is inane...just look at the stuff that manifests itself as 'entertainment' on TV as an example. So some folk have lost the opportunity to experience illness other than acute (usually short, obvious symptoms, diagnosed and mostly cured or run its course in couple of weeks) so chronic conditions (perhaps takes time to diagnose,  long-term and mostly not curable) or dramatic or traumatic scenarios are something to face suddenly and may not be within our often very small family units on a day to day basis. So some folk can't resist an 'in' ...an opportunity to relate something that for them needs mentioning...note for them...it is very much a one sided situation.  Some of these folk are exceptionally good at one sided and if it were in the Olympics we we would clear the medal board...as even if they are squarely and justifiably and unquestionably shown to be inappropriate...somehow they garner sympathy and outrage for themselves as the injured party as someone horribly wanted them to feel bad!!! OK I will stop while we all polish our halos  Err....lovely! Ahem! Cheers
Posts.Title: Just need a rant

Posts.Content: Hi LB68 You have no doubt heard the phrase 'its only the tension hiding you together'. So yes, its normal and common to have weird, fragile, down feelings after active treatment or surgery, sometimes many weeks layer when everything is going really well. Its as if you heave a sigh of relief and let all the walls down. Until now you have been getting on with the 'doing'  of it and only now have time to react. Counselling...sometimes we have to take what's on offer but in reality there are different types of counselling and you need to find a good match...just as it is perfectly acceptable to say the method of counselling g is OK but you and the first choice of counsellor ate not a good match. That is no reflection on either of you and part of the integrity of a profesdional counselling service. It is a shame you feel you ended up 'just chatting'.  Sometimes a chat is exactly what we need but that wasn't the counsellors remit and if a conversational style was part of their format, it failed to make the objectives clear to you. In these days of austerity, budgets and evidence, what is on offer is usually six sessions of a particular therapy. On this one hand this is good as it provides a framework and structure and all know  is on offer.  I see it however as a bit like offering size 6 shoes to those with bare feet. Great if 6 is what you need but... You don't say how you accessed the telephone counselling. If you are an employ of a reasonably sized organisation or a local authority etc, counselling may be a service offered to staff. If you are a member of a Trade Union check out what they can offer too...their policies will be on line..Unison has a Welfare Officer. You can also try via your GP, your local branch of Mind the mental health charity or if you have a MacMillan or Maggie's centre near you. Breast Cance rCare offer moving forward courses etc  Don't be hard on yourself. take care

Did get some sleep overnight hurray!  But in bits booooh!  But better than nothing hurray!  But woke feeling dreadful and like a hadn't slept for a week booooooh! Just now feel like I need a good refreshing sleep : ) Off to take dog out....sure the fresh air will be fabulous and the rain has stopped and the sun is trying to get through the clouds hurray.
